node.title: NZ vaccine mandates kick in, but they're the 'trojan horse' of the far-right movement
node.alt: A crowd of people on a road carrying flags and placards, including one with the words MEDIA TREASON and swastikas
node.description: From today, teachers and anyone else who works in a school in New Zealand needs to have at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine, but experts are warning with vaccination mandates and lingering lockdowns comes an increasing threat from far-right extremists.
node.content:
["New Zealand may have softened its zero-COVID strategy, but restrictions are lingering, vaccine mandates are now kicking in and the so-called \"freedom\" movement is angry.", "And its extreme elements pose\u00a0a significant and increasing security threat, according to several experts.", "When Jacinda Ardern moved away from eliminating\u00a0COVID and turned sharply towards vaccines as a way out of lockdown, commentators suggested she was taking a political risk because her ability to keep the virus out had been incredibly popular.", "But New Zealand does have a dissenting minority \u2014\u00a0people who are against any impingement on personal freedoms and who are increasingly radicalised by conspiracy theories and online disinformation.\u00a0", "Last week, many moved out from behind their screens and marched on the streets of the capital.\u00a0", "Thousands of protesters moved through Wellington towards parliament, chanting \"freedom\", some waving Trump flags, others carrying signs with Nazi symbolism.", "There were QAnon supporters and\u00a0signs that read \"drain the swamp\".\u00a0", "Threats were written in permanent marker\u00a0on tennis balls that were then thrown over barricades towards members of the press.", "Over the past 18 months, New Zealand has experienced some of the toughest lockdown restrictions in the world.\u00a0", "And Ms Ardern brought in new legislation requiring anyone\u00a0who works in border facilities, in a school, at a prison, as well as in any health or disability care setting to be fully vaccinated to be in their workplace.\u00a0", "Today is the deadline for all education, disability and health sector workers to have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.\u00a0", "That includes a long list of allied health professionals, such as physiotherapists, optometrists and chiropractors as well as teacher aides and boarding school staff.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "Ahead of today, there were predictions some schools would not be able to operate.\u00a0\u00a0", "The government has also said: \"all workers at businesses where customers will need to show COVID-19 vaccination certificates, such as hospitality and close contact businesses, will also need to be vaccinated.\"\u00a0", "The deadline for those workers is due to be announced shortly.\u00a0", "
Impact on the terror threat
", "", "
Some protesters waving Trump flags at the Wellington rally told reporters they believed Jacinda Ardern had been arrested at the White House two years ago.(AP/NZ Herald:\u00a0Mark Mitchell)
", "Extremism experts as well as New Zealand's own terrorism intelligence group have signalled these policies are likely to increase the domestic terrorism threat.", "In an intelligence report from November 2020, released to the public this week, the country's\u00a0Combined Threat Assessment Group said: \"We assess it is likely the consequences of the pandemic, such as online radicalisation and the emergence of COVID-19 specific grievances or conspiracy theories amongst a small portion of the population will have a detrimental effect on the terrorism threat environment in the long-term.\"\u00a0", "The report said there was a \"realistic possibility\" terrorist attack targets would be shaped by the effect the pandemic had on the economy and on \"extremists individually\".", "\"Such impacts are also conditional on when or if widespread introduction of a successful COVID-19 vaccine or treatment occurs, and the persistence and severity of related restrictions.\"\u00a0", "Alexander Gillespie, a professor of law at the University of Waikato,\u00a0said New Zealand was now approaching the conditions the intelligence warned about.", "\"What the report says is that if a particular restriction starts to bite on an extremist, the more likely it is you'll get a reaction,\" he said.", "", "
Protesters rallied\u00a0against COVID-19\u00a0restrictions and vaccine mandates in Wellington.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Praveen Menon)
", "The report says the most likely terror scenario would be a \"lone actor\".\u00a0", "Dr Gillespie said the risk increased when a policy like mandatory vaccinations impacted them in a very real way.", "\"So it doesn't just become a theoretical concern for someone. It becomes very personal because they lose their income and then if that person is alienated or off the radar, that's where the risk is.\"\u00a0", "\"It's from this week \u2014\u00a0and over the next couple of weeks \u2014 [as vaccination\u00a0deadlines arrive] that people are going to have to start making choices, and that's when the risk could escalate.\"", "
Threats in Auckland
", "New Zealand's terrorism intelligence group assessed any target of an attack would be shaped by the COVID response.\u00a0", "Auckland University's Te Punaha Matatini research centre released a white paper last week, detailing trends in mis and disinformation since the start of New Zealand's Delta outbreak.\u00a0", "\"Women associated with the COVID-19 response as politicians, healthcare professionals or experts are targeted individually for harassment, \u2026 including death and\u00a0rape threats.\" the research found.\u00a0", "\"Public figures \u2014 particularly minorities \u2014 continue to receive disproportionate harmful\u00a0attention. Figures such as the Prime Minister receive a particularly insidious form of\u00a0abuse, as well as other women across government, academia, public service,\u00a0journalism, M\u0101ori leadership\u00a0and any form of public life.\"", "Auckland councillor and Samoan woman Josephine Bartley fits that description.\u00a0", "", "
Auckland councillor Josephine Bartley has received abuse for promoting the vaccine to her community.\u00a0(ABC News: Benji Timu)
", "Ms Bartley has been promoting the benefits of vaccination within the community and receives threats and abuse on social media, directly to her email, Messenger accounts and work phone.\u00a0", "Recently, three men approached her and a threat was issued in person.\u00a0", "\"I'd been notified that the Pasifika Family Health Group had been vandalised, so I went down there. I checked on the CEO and the staff and they were all shaken and upset,\" she said.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"I went live on my Facebook [page] about it and\u00a0we all assumed it was anti-vax [motivated vandalism]\u00a0because the centre had received threats and online abuse leading up to the event\u00a0we put on the day before, and so we were calling out the anti-vax violence, saying keep it to yourself.\"\u00a0\u00a0", "Later, Ms Bartley returned to her car.\u00a0", "\"I looked over and saw these three men staring at me,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I heard one guy yell out, 'You're all scum'. So I wound down my window and said, 'Sorry, what was that?\u00a0I didn't quite hear you'.", "A fellow councillor hired security to sit outside Ms Bartley's home.\u00a0", "", "
Ms Bartley said she now travelled to vaccination events with colleagues to feel more secure.\u00a0
", "Now, as she moves across the city, doing her job and supporting community vaccination drives, Ms Bartley is forced to look over her shoulder.\u00a0", "\"I just think, 'Man, I have to change how I do things because of fear' and I've never been someone that has had my life dictated to me out of fear,\" she said.\u00a0", "The councillor said the incident felt like an escalation and \"the level of anger, hate and resentment\" the men had towards her was not something she had experienced before.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"These men didn't see me as a person, they didn't engage with me when I\u00a0was asking them a question and that unsettled me,\" she said.\u00a0\u00a0", "Ms Bartley said the abuse and threats now levelled at public figures was very distressing.\u00a0", "Fellow Auckland councillor Efeso Collins received death threats earlier this year after campaigning for the show Police Ten 7 to be cancelled for its alleged racist stereotyping.\u00a0", "And there have been multiple prosecutions over death threats sent to Ms Ardern.", "
COVID policies\u00a0become\u00a0'Trojan Horse'
", "Auckland has spent more than 150 days under lockdown since the pandemic began and was the city where the Delta variant first broke through the border.", "The \"freedom movement\" has protested against the lockdowns, as well as\u00a0mandatory vaccinations.\u00a0", "Researchers say the far-right faction of the movement has also used these two COVID-19 policies to spread their messages and further entrench their ideologies.\u00a0", "Since the latest outbreak began, \"there has been a sharp increase\u00a0in the\u00a0popularity and intensity of COVID-19-specific disinformation and other forms of\u00a0'dangerous speech' and disinformation, related to far-right ideologies\", the\u00a0Te Punaha Matatini research found.", "On messaging platform Telegram, the sentiment towards vaccines has shifted from \"hesitancy and uncertainty\" to \"active resistance and refusal\".\u00a0", "The conversations have also become \"more violent and graphic\".\u00a0", "Dr Gillespie said the crowd that marched towards New Zealand's parliament, had a very particular trait \u2014 it was a diverse group.\u00a0", "There were extreme elements among it, but\u00a0with mandates impacting\u00a0professions like teaching and nursing, the \"freedom movement\" was actually collecting a lot of people who would not normally be associated with anti-government protests.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"Certainly the far right is there, and some people want to cause chaos, but I don't think it's just them.\"\u00a0", "Vaccination\u00a0deadlines are arriving, but Dr Gillespie said the decision to slowly move away from restrictions would help to dispel some of the anger.\u00a0", "\"They've also introduced a different type of vaccine, so that will also release some steam\u00a0because some people are very concerned about Pfizer,\" he said.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"But I imagine there is still going to be a group who are not going to be vaccinated under any situation.", "\"Say you're a schoolteacher and you choose for whatever reason to not get vaccinated and you lose your job, some of these people are going to be very angry and I don't think you can discount that anger completely, so security services \u2026 have got to be vigilant about what could happen next.\"\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0"]
